fields.name: txtPart2AddAmt
fields.title: Line 3. Add the amounts in column (c) of line 2. Don't enter more than $8, 000 if you had one qualifying person or $16, 000 if you had two or more persons. If you completed Part III, enter the amount from line 31

fields.name: txtPart2EarnedInc
fields.title: Line 4. Enter your earned income. See instructions

fields.name: txtPart2SpEarnedInc
fields.title: Line 5. If  married filing jointly, enter your spouse's earned income (if you or your spouse was a student or was disabled, see the instructions); all others, enter the amount from line 4

fields.name: txtPart2Smallest
fields.title: Line 6. This field is automatically calculated for you

fields.name: txtPart2AdjGrossInc

fields.title: Attach previous year expenses explanation statement

fields.name: txtPart2PriyrPaidExpenses
fields.title: If you paid 2020 expenses in 2021, complete Worksheet A in the instructions. Enter the amount from line 13 of the worksheet here. Otherwise, go to line 10

fields.name: txtPart2RefundableCredit
fields.title: Line 10. This field is automatically calculated for you

fields.name: txtPart2Cdcdt
fields.title: Line 11. Nonrefundable credit for child and dependent care expenses. If you didn't check the box on line B above, your credit is nonrefundable and limited by the amount of your tax; see the instructions to figure the portion of line 10 that you can claim and enter that amount here and on Schedule 3 (Form 1040), line 2

fields.name: txtPart3DepCareBen
fields.title: Part 3. Dependent Care Benefits. Line 12. Enter the total amount of dependent care benefits you received in 2021. Amounts you received as an employee should be shown in box 10 of your Form(s) W-2. Don't include amounts reported as wages in box 1 of Form(s) W-2. If you were self-employed or a partner, include amounts you received under a dependent care assistance program from your sole proprietorship or partnership

fields.name: txtPart3AmtCarryOver
fields.title: Line 13. Enter the amount, if any, you carried over from 2020 and used in 2021. See instructions

fields.name: txtPart3AmtFor
fields.title: Line 14. Enter the amount, if any, you forfeited or carried forward to 2022. See instructions

fields.name: txtPart3Diff12
fields.title: Line 15. This field is automatically calculated for you

fields.name: txtPart3QualExp
fields.title: Line 16. Enter the total amount of qualified expenses incurred in 2021 for the care of the qualifying person(s)

fields.name: txtPart3Small14
fields.title: Line 17. This field is automatically calculated for you

fields.name: txtPart3EarnedInc
fields.title: Line 18. Enter your earned income. See instructions

fields.name: txtPart3SpEarnedInc
fields.title: Line 19. Enter the amount shown below that applies to you. If married filing jointly, enter your spouse's earned income (if you or your spouse was a student or was disabled, see the instructions for line 5). If married filing separately, see  instructions. All others, enter the amount from line 18

fields.name: txtPart3Small17
fields.title: Line 20. This field is automatically calculated for you

fields.name: txtPart3LimitOn22
fields.title: Line 21. Enter $10, 500 ($5, 250 if married filing separately and you were required to enter your spouse's earned income on line 19). If you entered an amount on line 13, add it to the $10, 500 or $5, 250 amount you enter on line 21

options.label: No. Enter Zero. - Line 22. Is any amount on line 12 or 13 from your sole proprietorship or partnership?
